noun.description: A tetragonal aluminosilicate mineral that is the sodium- and chloride-rich endmember of the scapolite series and occurs as transparent or translucent crystals of various colours.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in James Dana (1813–1895), geologist, zoologist, and teacher. From German Marialit (now Marialith) from Maria + -lit.
